Hopper digging hot springs .. surprised me.
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Monster Types: Hopper: Hopper digging hot springs .. surprised me.
By DigitaLink on Monday, December 17, 2001 - 08:14 am:

After reading postings, I thought that the hopper (I'm raising a Woody Hopper, currently 6y 3m, B rank, finished his .. my .. first Elder's Cup succesfully) would ONLY dig on the first week of December ... so when I put him in the December official to become a B I thought I'd have to wait another year. I rested him the first week of January and almost fell out of my chair (literally) when Jan 2wk he dug up the springs! I think he had 40 or 50 fame at the time, but had LITERALLY just become a B the week before. So for 'Anonymous' who couldn't get it to dig ... it wasn't because of the December 4 official ... it had to be something else. So from this I would guess that the hot springs can be dug up at any point in the winter months. Now to figure out what the Undines are like and why we've never seen one in battle before. Are they just crappy monsters to raise or what?

Chris Pollard ... guy who had a D go to Kawrea with Talico on first adventure of a fresh game.

By torey_luvullo on Monday, December 17, 2001 - 08:31 am:

nope - for some reason, the game didn't put an undine in as an enemy monster. [this is also true of wracky and mock] but there are many on the board who have raised very good undines, and they have excellent techs. you can raise one along similar lines as a pixie - int and skill are a must, but they do less well in spd and better in def and lif.

By Nate Railsback on Monday, December 17, 2001 - 08:30 pm:

Undines absolutely rock. They're great in all stats except Power, and they have way better moves than Pixie could ever have. Check out my Undine Analysis in the monsters section for the full story.
